subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Running back Fred Taylor wanted to end his career in Jacksonville, hoping to join a small list of standout N.F.L. players who spent an entire career with the same team, but the Jaguars released him, parting ways with their career leading rusher after 11 seasons. Coach Jack Del Rio flew to Fort Lauderdale, Fla., to deliver the news. Taylor, 33, was scheduled to make $6 million next season. ¶The Baltimore Ravens released cornerback Chris McAlister, a 10-year veteran and 3-time Pro Bowler. McAlister, 31, who started for Baltimore’s Super Bowl winner in 2001, ranked third on the Ravens’ career list with 26 interceptions. He started five games last season before being benched and was placed on injured reserve with an injury to his right knee Nov. 11. He was to make $8 million this year. ravens.
